turns.content:
I interviewed Tommy and asked him what salary he needed for the position I interviewed him for. I emailed him an offer letter for the position with the salary he needed. He replied to the email and said-

Looking over the terms, salary, benefits, and speaking with my wife, this offer would be a step back for me from my current employment. Would UNG be able to increase the salary?

Compose a reply to him and explain that UNG feels that the offer that was sent to him is on par for his experience and knowledge and that we are not able to increase the salary. He currently works for the state at a school district and he receives more PTO and better insurance benefits since he works for the state. Explain to him that unfortunately we are not able to compete with the state in regards to the PTO and insurance benefits.

Dear Tommy,

Thank you for your email regarding the offer letter for the position we discussed. We understand that the salary offered may be a step back from your current employment, however, we feel that the offer is on par for your experience and knowledge.

Unfortunately, UNG is not able to increase the salary at this time. We understand that as a state employee, you may receive more PTO and better insurance benefits. However, we are not able to compete with the state in regards to these benefits.

We hope that you will still consider this opportunity as we believe that you would be a valuable asset to our team. Please let us know if you have any further questions or concerns.

Best,
[Your Name]
